[color=#FFFFE0][b]Hack Forums under maintenance [/b][/color]
On September the 18th our administrator [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] announced that he was working on a server which was causing HF to crash multiple times this past week. After a good few hours of researching what was causing the crashes [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] discovered that the recent crashes were probably due to a broken SSD drive in the RAID configuration. In the upcoming few days this is most likely going to be fixed by the hosting company. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5409220]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=#FFFFE0][b]New Prestige requirement in Counter Strike forum[/b][/color]
Two days ago [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] announced that members are now required to have atleast 25 prestige to post in the Counter Strike forum. This new requirement was added in an attempt to reduce the amount of trolling and LQ posts. If you're upgraded into L33T or UB3R (not 3P1C) this requirement is bypassed. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5408230]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[size=x-small]* = prior to the Friday of release![/size]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/NotableThreads.png[/img][/align]

[list][b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5409220][b]Maintenance Today[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
Hack Forums' has recently been experiencing a lot of down time. The past week (of Edition 309) Hack Forums has gone down at least twice due to the kernal server crashing. Omniscient is doing his best to get everything back running smoothly, so please bear with him.

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5408230][b]Prestige Requirement[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
There are some forums that require you to have a certain prestige amount in order to post. Omniscient has added a very popular forum to this list. In order to post in the Counter Strike forum you need to have at least 25 prestige or more. If you upgrade to Ub3r or L33t status this requirement does not apply to you, even if you do not have the prestige amount required. This rule was created to help stop all the trolling that has been going on in the forum.

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5407463][b]Kernal Crash[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
The first kernal crash happened on the 16 of Sept. Hack Forums was down for around three hours. Due to these down times Omniscient is heavily backing up the forum just in case Hack Forums loses any data.

[url=hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5339673][b]Poke Ball Award[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
This is not so much a new thread. What is new about it is the fact that Omniscient is now suspending the Poke Ball award due to the activity in the Pokemon Go forum going down in numbers. It seems that the forum is not so active as it once was. Do you think Omniscient will bring back the award another time to hopefully boost activity?[/list][/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5409666][b]Confound's Film/TV Help Desk | Q+A, Recommendations, + More[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2920830][b][color=#FFFFFF]Confound[/color][/b][/url]
This handy thread is for those looking for a new show or movie to watch. If you are in the need of a particular show or movie and don't want to go through the hassle of searching for one, come here and request some help from Confound!

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5392367][b][Tutorial] How to host a TOR hidden service[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2192831][b][color=#FFFFFF]Lrrr[/color][/b][/url]
We are sadly a little late to bring you this tutorial, but regardless of Ariana's mistake, here we have a very highly detailed thread by the user Lrrr. It is noted at the very beginning of this thread that this guide is not for any black hat activity so be cautious with what you do! If you want to learn how to host your very own hidden service on TOR, come check this awesome thread out. Nicely done, Lrrr!

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5408927][b][The Order] How to Hide Your Files Inside a Picture[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2636436][b][color=#FFFFFF]Epilepsy[/color][/b][/url]
As explained within the thread: maybe there is some porn on your PC or something very secretive you would like to hide. If you want to hide something within a picture, Epilepsy can help you with that.

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5405693][b](TUT)Hack Wifi Hotspots in Hotels, Coffee shops, and more[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1551759][b][color=#FFFFFF]Randelixim[/color][/b][/url]
Beginner guide that is very useful and will assist you on you hacking journey. If you want to learn how to hack public hotspots then come here.

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5405985][b]How to hook ROBLOX methods in a Lua environment that can modify protected metatables[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3283245][b][color=#99FF00]Informable[/color][/b][/url]
Coding is obviously going to be involved in this so if you have no experience with Lua, this is not the thread for you. Well, maybe it is. Who are we to tell you it is not! If you are looking to spend some time on a project then this thread will give you just that.[/list][/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5409396][b]Things You Go Back To?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3189428][b][color=#FFFFFF]Don Vasquez[/color][/b][/url]
In this day and age people have many different hobbies and things they like to do. Have anything cool or special to share that you do in your free time?

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5404717][b]Post a pic of yourself?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2682887][b][color=#FFFFFF]Mr. Robot[/color][/b][/url]
Mr. Robot's "Post a picture of yourself" thread has been surfacing the first page of The Lounge for a few days. A few troll pics, with a little bit of some actual members showing what they look like. Curious to see what your favorite HF member looks like? Maybe you want to share too. Post it here.

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5409068][b][UPDATED]POODLECORP IS BACK?![/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2866514][b][color=#FFFFFF]kmz22222[/color][/b][/url]
Apparently Poodlecorp is back. Do not think anyone even knew they were on a hiatus. Or did we?!

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5408525][b]Made a Prank call on indian teach scammers[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3116015][b][color=#99FF00]Will Grigg[/color][/b][/url]
Come check out this interesting prank call by the user Will Gregg. Majority of the comments are good so it must be a good listen![/list][/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5407712][b]5 years (& 2 months), 3000 posts[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=891000][b][color=#00AAFF]Xeru[/color][/b][/url]
Ex-Writer, Xeru, has created a feedback thread in celebration of being a member of Hack Forums for over five years. Congrats, dude.

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5404659][b]Riyu's 4 months feedback[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3129680][b][color=#FFFFFF]Riyu[/color][/b][/url]
Four months may not be much for some users on the forum, but that does not stop someone from celebrating it. Riyu has been a member of this forum for over four months and has done many different giveaways to give back to the community. Come check their feedback thread out to show some love.[/list][/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Contests and Giveaways[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1743548][b]$50 BTC/PP giveaway[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1743548][b][color=#FFFFFF]Excah[/color][/b][/url]
Excah is giving away a generous amount of money. If you are lucky enough to win this contest you will have the option to choose Paypal or Bitcoin as a payment.

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5395748][b]All Members! (OPEN) $15 BTC/PP Giveaway (lask week winners) No requirements[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3063625][b][color=#00AAFF]Arkks[/color][/b][/url]
All members allowed! Enter if you would like the chance to win $15!

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5397232][b]SZociety - 5 Letter OG Gamertag Giveaway[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3139543][b][color=#00AAFF]SZociety[/color][/b][/url]
Ever wanted an OG gamertag but never had the chance to own one? Well, now you have a chance thanks to SZociety who is giving away a five letter original Gamertag!
[/list][/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5409361][b]Just got an iPhone 7[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][b][color=#00AAFF]Ariana[/color][/b][/url]
Ariana just got the brand new iPhone 7. If you believe Android is the master race come invade this thread and explain so. If not, come discuss your opinions on the new iPhone.

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5400189][b]Post Your Best Songs[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3106226][b][color=#00AAFF]VeloCityMods[/color][/b][/url]
Think you have the best songs on Hack Forums? Want to show off your groovy tunes? VeloCityMods created a thread asking users to show off their best. Why not put your song to the very test!

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5409288][b]Waifu season, pick yours <.<[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2194264][b][color=#99FF00]     severos[/color][/b][/url]
Think you have a best girl? Claim your waifu in this thread. It is not official so do not get mad if someone else takes your babe.

[url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5408490][b]I WANT ALL YOUR MOVIES RECOMMENDATIONS[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=992800][b][color=#00AAFF]#YOLO[/color][/b][/url]
Come help this user out. #YOLO is in need of some good movies. Come on, you have been in that situation. Why not help a buddy out?[/list][/list][/size][/font]
posts.subject: Hack Forums News // Edition 309

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/Memo-Wires.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Weekly Rotation[/color][/b]
Yet again we have begun our weekly rotation. The weekly rotation allows Writers to publish the news as an incentive (and reward too I guess) to contributing to the upcoming edition. It's not everyday the voluntary sectional writers and the On-Call Team get a shout-out for their hard work, so well done guys. On another note, I really need to go to the toilet so I'll end it there...

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/SNews-Abide.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[color=white][url=http://www.popsci.com/ice-cores-from-melting-glaciers-will-be-stored-in-antarctica][b]Ice Cores from Melting Glaciers Will Be Stored in Antarctica[/b][/url][/color]
A unique new project started by scientists from France and Italy is underway. The project titled "Protecting Ice Memory" was started to essentially build a library containing samples from glaciers that are melting. Global warming is to blame for the melting of many impressive glaciers around the world, and this project aims to preserve samples for scientists to study in the future. These scientists are constantly collecting ice cores from almost every glacier on the planet and burying them over thirty feet underground in Antarctica. Ice cores have air bubbles frozen and locked within which can help researchers study how the environment has changed over time. The information from these ice cores could help scientists understand how rapid climate change is affecting the world.

[color=white][url=https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/09/160919132518.htm][b]Unusual Short Burst of X-Rays Coming from Slowest-Spinning Neutron Star[/b][/url][/color]
For the longest time NASA had thought they had found the slowest spinning neutron star, but they were wrong. NASA's state of the art observatory named "Swift" has found a new neutron star thanks to an X-ray burst. The X-ray burst was a very strong and rapid burst, which caught the eye of astronomers at the observatory. NASA used a team of astronomers at their "Chandra" observatory to assist in the investigation of the star. This neutron star they discovered rotates only once every six and a half hours, which makes it the slowest spinning star by far ever recorded. 


[color=white][url=https://www.sciencenews.org/blog/science-ticker/arctic-sea-ice-shrinks-second-lowest-low-record?mode=topic&context=60][b]Arctic Sea Ice Shrinks to Second-Lowest Low on Record[/b][/url][/color]
Climate change has negatively affected ice formations around the world for years, but the sea ice around the North Pole has reached its second-lowest on record. Currently the arctic sea ice is tied with the 2007 record. Ice formations around the arctic sea hit their expected low for the year, hitting an area of over four million square kilometers, which is way below the old average of six million square kilometers. The record lowest arctic ice low was in 2012 when the area hit barely three million square kilometers. Shrinking sea ice in the area is a serious problem, which not only speeds up global warming, but also spreads pollution, and threatens Arctic animal species. 
[/align]

[color=transparent]    [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/5EHiJAb.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[color=white][url=https://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2016/09/return-to-libstagefright-exploiting.html][b]Google Patches Two Critical Bugs in Android[/b][/url][/color]
It has been a bad week for millions of Android phone users. Two critical Android vulnerabilities were recently disclosed and patched on Android devices via an over-the-air security update. The first, discovered by Google Project Zero researcher Mark Brand, allows an attacker to remotely execute malware or escalate local privileges on exposed phones. Despite its "straightforward" nature, the bug is "extremely serious" and can be spread in a variety of ways, Brand wrote in a blog post. The same update patches a second vulnerability similar to Stagefright. The bug is exploited by hiding malicious code in embedded JPEG image data, then sending the picture via Gmail or Google Talk. The unsuspecting target does not need to click on or open any links to become compromised.

[color=white][url=http://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2016/09/feds-explosive-samsung-galaxy-note-7-earns-official-cpsc-recall-status/][b]US Consumer Safety Agency Formally Recalls the Note 7 in the US[/b][/url][/color]
After weeks of investigation, the US Consumer Product Safety Commission announced a formal recall of the Galaxy Note 7 in conjunction with Samsung Thursday. The recall will include about 1 million of the premium mobile phones because of serious fire and burn hazards, CPSC chairman Elliot Kaye said at a press conference. If the phone is included in the recall, which almost all phones sold in the US are, customers can take the phone back to Samsung directly or to their carrier to receive a refund or a replacement phone. The U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission has urged customers to "immediately stop using and power down" the device.

[color=white][url=http://www.pcgamer.com/valve-removes-digital-homicides-games-from-steam/][b]Valve Removes All of Digital Homicide's Games From Steam[/b][/url][/color]
If you write a negative review for a game, is that considered harassment? It is according to indie game developer Digital Homicide whom is suing 100 Steam users for $18 million. The game developer is facing repercussions from Valve after it decided to file a lawsuit against a band of anonymous Steam users. The suit alleges a number of offenses, including cyberbullying, stalking, forming a hate group to harass and disrupt the company's business and products, and so forth. In response to the lawsuit, Valve removed all 18 of the developer's games from their digital storefront. According to Valve, they "stopped doing business with Digital Homicide for being hostile to Steam customers."
[/align][/size][/font]

[url=http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2016/09/18/what-we-know-now-explosion-new-york-chelsea/90614202/][color=#FFFFFF][b]Bombing in New York City[/b][/color][/url]
On the night of Saturday, September 17, a bomb detonated at 133 W. 23rd St., between Sixth and Seventh Avenue, which is more commonly known to be the Chelsea neighborhood. There were 29 people who were injured from the bombing itself. Later that night, there was another device found four blocks away on West 27th Street. Thankfully, the device did not destruct and the bomb was safely removed. As of September 19, authorities believe the primary suspect to be 28-year-old Ahmad Khan Rahami. Rahami is now currently in custody after a shootout with police.

[url=http://www.si.com/extra-mustard/2016/09/15/harambe-jerseys-sale-nfl-shop][color=#FFFFFF][b]Harambe Jerseys are now Back for Sale[/b][/color][/url]
The notorious gorilla that was put down back in May of 2016 has sparked many people's attention over recent months. In case you are not familiar, the gorilla was killed at the Cincinnati Zoo after a child ended up dropping down into the gorilla pit. Many memes have been created to show respect for the gorilla online. However, on September 14, the name "Harambe" was put on the blacklist of names for custom named jerseys. A spokesperson from Fanatics, which works with NFL's online sales, said, “It turns out an employee, in an effort to be vigilant and keep the banned list as current as possible, took it upon themselves to ban the word across our sites. Once we realized the error, we fixed the issue and Harambe is now available again.”

[url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/09/19/us/minnesota-mall-stabbing/][color=#FFFFFF][b]Minnesota Mall Attack[/b][/color][/url]
On Saturday, September 17, there appeared to be yet another terrorist attack. A man, who is now identified as 22-year-old Dahir A. Adan, went on a rampage at a Minnesota Mall. Adan stabbed nine people before an off-duty police officer fatally shot the man. The ISIS wing is now claiming responsibility for this attack. The town in where this attack happened, Saint Cloud, is home to one of Minnesota's largest Muslim immigrant communities. With this in mind, people often tend to make the correlation between Muslim individuals and ISIS. A news conference was held by Muslim and Somali communities to mourn the victims and call for unity. "We are also concerned about the potential backlash," said Jaylani Hussein, executive director of the Council on American-Islamic Relations chapter in Minnesota. "We understand in St. Cloud there is more anti-Muslim organizing, and we hope they do not use this incident to divide (our community)."
